sect1.title: Actions and Definitions
sect1.para: There are several built-in Actions in ECL (such as OUTPUT), but there are many more actions that you can execute as queries to the supercomputer. Fundamentally, an Action is simply an expression that produces a result that has not been given a definition name.

sect2.title: Debugging Uses
sect2.para: This technique of directly executing a Definition as an Action is useful when debugging complex ECL code. You can send the Definition as a query to determine if intermediate values are correctly calculated before continuing on with more complex code.
